intro: Parasenecio hosoianus, commonly known as the Hosoian's parthenium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, displaying small, yellowish to white flowers arranged in a composite structure. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapting to arid environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
